description: Listed Building Consent in connection with the demolition of single storey brick workshop in rear service yard (133B), partial demolition of single storey extension to 133 and erection of a five storey building comprising ground and four upper floors. Reconfiguration of ground floor openings to rear wing of No.133 and erection of single story glazed structure to courtyard elevation. Dual/alternative use of basement and ground floor of 133 and 133B as either Class A3 restaurant or Class B1 offices. Use of first to fourth floors of new building at 133B as three self-contained residential flats (Class C3). Resurfacing of courtyard with cobbles.
decision: Called in by Secretary of State
decision_conditions: REASON: The proposed works by virtue of the loss of the existing garage/stable building and the impact of the proposed five-storey building and the new glazed ground floor extension (by virtue of height, bulk and specific design), would adversely affect the special architectural and historic interest of the listed building contrary to policy 12 (Conserving and enhancing the historic environment) of the National Planning Policy Framework 2012, policy 7.8 (Sustaining and enhancing the significance of heritage assets) of the London Plan 2011 and policy CS9 (Protecting and enhancing Islington’s built and historic environment) of Islington’s Core Strategy 2011.
